Stir in the chocolate chips by hand using a wooden spoon.
Drop cookie dough 1/4 cup at a time onto ungreased baking sheets. Cookies should be about 3 inches apart.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.
Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Pavlova
description: Pavlova is a light and airy meringue dessert with a crisp crust and soft, marshmallow-like interior. Topped with whipped cream and fresh fruit, it offers a delightful contrast of textures and flavorss. The meringue base is crispy yet delicate, providing a sweet and slightly chewy experience with every bite. It is beautifully complemented by billowy whipped cream and a colorful array of fresh fruits, making it a stunning centerpiece for any dessert table.
ingredients: Fresh fruit for topping (such as strawberries, kiwi, and blueberries)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Draw a 9-inch circle on the parchment paper as a guide.
In a large bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add the 1 cup sugar, beating until stiff, glossy peaks form.
Beat in the vinegar and vanilla. Sift cornstarch over the top and fold in gently.
Spoon meringue onto the parchment paper within the circle. Shape into a disc with a slight depression in the center.
Bake for 1 hour. Turn off the oven and let the meringue cool completely in the oven with the door slightly ajar.
In a medium bowl, beat the heavy cream with 2 tablespoons sugar until soft peaks form.
Spoon whipped cream onto the cooled meringue and top with fresh fruit.

name: Vanilla Pound Cake
description: Vanilla Pound Cake is a rich and buttery cake with a dense yet tender crumb. Enhanced with vanilla bean paste for a robust vanilla flavor, this cake is perfect for serving plain, with fresh fruit, or topped with whipped cream for a delightful dessert or tea-time treat.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste or vanilla extract
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C). Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla bean paste or vanilla extract and sour cream.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan, spreading evenly.
Bake for 70-80 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cake in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Slice and enjoy your homemade Vanilla Pound Cake!

name: Pandesal
description: Pandesal is a classic Filipino bread roll that is soft, fluffy, and slightly sweet. It is traditionally enjoyed as a breakfast bread or snack, often paired with butter, cheese, or jams. The crust is lightly crunchy while the inside is tender and chewy, making it a beloved staple in Filipino cuisine.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine lukewarm water, sugar, and yeast. Let sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
Add evaporated milk, melted butter, and salt to the yeast mixture, stirring until well combined.
Gradually add bread flour, mixing until dough comes together.
Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and knead for 10-12 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean towel, and let rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours until doubled in size.
Punch down dough and divide into 24 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball.
Roll each ball in bread crumbs, coating evenly, and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Cover shaped dough with a towel and let rise again for 30-45 minutes until puffy.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Bake pandesal for 18-20 minutes until golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack before serving.
Enjoy your homemade Pandesal!

name: Mexican Street Corn Salad
description: Mexican Street Corn Salad, also known as 'Esquites', is a vibrant salad featuring charred corn kernels tossed with creamy mayonnaise, tangy lime juice, chili powder, and crumbled cotija cheese. Garnished with fresh cilantro and a hint of smoky paprika, this salad offers a burst of flavors reminiscent of traditional street food. Serve Mexican Street Corn Salad as a side dish or appetizer.
ingredients: 4 cups fresh corn kernels (about 4 ears of corn)
Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, char the fresh corn kernels until lightly browned and caramelized.

Transfer the charred corn kernels to a large bowl. Add mayonnaise, sour cream, crumbled cotija cheese, chopped fresh cilantro, seeded and minced jalapeno pepper, fresh lime juice, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Toss all the ingredients together until well combined and evenly coated with the dressing.
Serve Mexican Street Corn Salad immediately as a flavorful side dish or appetizer.
Enjoy your homemade Mexican Street Corn Salad!

name: Minestrone Soup
description: Minestrone Soup is a hearty Italian soup filled with vegetables, beans, pasta, and aromatic herbs in a flavorful tomato broth. It's a versatile dish that can include a variety of seasonal vegetables such as carrots, celery, zucchini, and spinach. Minestrone Soup is nourishing and satisfying, perfect for chilly evenings or as a starter for an Italian-inspired meal.
ingredients: 1 cup green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup small pasta (such as ditalini or small shells)
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add zucchini, green beans, diced tomatoes with their juices, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes.
Add cannellini beans, pasta, dried oregano, and dried basil. Cook until pasta is al dente, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
Enjoy your hearty Minestrone Soup!

name: Ratatouille
description: Ratatouille is a classic French Provençal stewed vegetable dish originating from Nice. It is made with a variety of seasonal vegetables including eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, onions, garlic, and tomatoes, cooked slowly until tender and flavorful. The vegetables are typically sautéed separately to enhance their individual flavors, then combined and simmered together in a rich tomato sauce infused with herbs like thyme, basil, and oregano. Ratatouille is a versatile dish that can be served hot or cold, as a main dish or a side, making it a perfect choice for vegetarians and vegans alike.
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the diced eggplant and cook for 5-6 minutes until softened and lightly browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Add another tablespoon of olive oil to the skillet. Add the diced zucchini and bell peppers, and sauté for 4-5 minutes until slightly tender. Remove from the skillet and set aside with the eggplant.
In the same skillet, add the diced onion and cook for 3-4 minutes until softened and translucent.
Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, dried thyme, dried basil, and dried oregano. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Return the cooked eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers to the skillet. Stir to combine with the tomato mixture.
Simmer the Ratatouille over low heat for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve the Ratatouille hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves.
Enjoy your Ratatouille!

name: Strawberry Banana Smoothie
description: Strawberry Banana Smoothie is a refreshing and nutritious blended drink made with fresh strawberries, ripe bananas, yogurt, and a splash of orange juice. It has a creamy texture and a naturally sweet flavors from the fruits, enhanced by the tangy yogurt and citrusy orange juice. This smoothie is packed with vitamins and antioxidants, making it a healthy and satisfying choice for breakfast or as a quick energy boost during the day.
instructions: In a blender, combine strawberries, banana, yogurt, orange juice, and honey or agave syrup if using.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add ice cubes and blend again until desired consistency.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
Enjoy your refreshing Strawberry Banana Smoothie!

name: Beef Wellington
description: Beef Wellington is an elegant and decadent dish featuring a tender beef fillet coated with mushroom duxelles, wrapped in puff pastry, and baked until golden brown. The beef is seared to seal in juices, then coated with a savory mixture of finely chopped mushrooms, shallots, garlic, and herbs. The puff pastry envelops the beef, creating a flaky, buttery crust that contrasts beautifully with the tender meat and earthy mushroom filling. Beef Wellington is often served with a rich red wine sauce, making it a luxurious centerpiece for special occasions.
ingredients: 8 ounces cremini or button mushrooms, finely chopped
1 sheet puff pastry, thawed if frozen
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Season the beef tenderloin generously with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over high heat. Sear the beef on all sides until browned, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet and let cool.

In the same skillet, add a little more olive oil if needed. Add the chopped mushrooms, shallots, garlic, and thyme. Cook until the mushrooms release their liquid and the mixture becomes dry, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a size that will wrap around the beef completely.
Spread the mushroom mixture evenly over the puff pastry. Place the seared beef on top of the mushroom mixture.
Fold the puff pastry over the beef, sealing the edges. Trim any excess pastry and crimp the edges to seal.
Brush the pastry with beaten egg for a golden finish.

Transfer the Beef Wellington to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the internal temperature of the beef reaches 125°F (52°C) for medium-rare.
Let the Beef Wellington rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with a rich red wine sauce.
Enjoy your Beef Wellington!
